Articles.Content:
Hello all.

I've been playing KSP for half a month now and I have been enjoying myself greatly. I've found dozens of helpful tutorials, mods and posts on this forum, so I thought, why not get an account.

I've managed to do most smaller things ingame (orbit, land on the Mun and Minmus and build a spacestation), I must admit I havn't bothered learning the rendezvouz and docking procedures, I'm a little impatient. I'm in love with the old rockets from the past, and have been using mods to recreate some of the old capsules and launch vehicles, hopefully even more in the future.

Well, I guess thats about it.

Hi Yakolev and welcome to the KSP forums

Landing on the Mun is no small thing, it takes a lot of skill and patience to master, so you should be proud

It'd be cool to see some pics of your historic rockets, you can upload them to imgur.com (no need for an account) and post the url's here

Hi Yakolev and welcome to the KSP forums

Landing on the Mun is no small thing, it takes a lot of skill and patience to master, so you should be proud

It'd be cool to see some pics of your historic rockets, you can upload them to imgur.com (no need for an account) and post the url's here

Thanks for the welcome, when I'm near my KSP machine I'll be sure to make screenshots (F12 on steam right?)

My first 3-4 Mun landings ended in disaster, especially not knowing about the save button. But being stranded is better than outright dying I guess.
